snippet: Jeffrey Babbitt, who died after he was attacked, loved steam locomotives, comic books, Goth art and winged fairies; a rabbi at his grave site called his killing senseless.
abstract: Memorial service is held in Manhattan's Union Square for Jeffrey Babbitt, who died after he was attacked by assailant Martin Redrick in what police have deemed random attack; Babbitt, a retired train hostler, regularly visited Union Square, where he was so well liked by workers at local haunts, like the Forbidden Planet comic store, that they chose to honor him with memorial service.
lead_paragraph: Jeffrey Babbitt, who died after he was attacked, loved steam locomotives, comic books, Goth art and winged fairies; a rabbi at his grave site called his killing senseless.

headline.main: Fanciful Adieu for Victim Who Saw World’s ‘Hidden Magic’
headline.print_headline: Fanciful Adieu for Victim Who Saw World’s ‘Hidden Magic’
